name: Hotel Polski Pod Bialym Orlem

reviews.title: Great location and friendly staff
reviews.text: This hotel is perfect for a trip to Krakow. Kind of a mix of socialist furniture with faux French styling, the friendly staff are very knowledgable about their beautiful city. Walking distance to everything you want to see, but taxis are plentiful and cheap (but make the deal before you get in). Walking distance to the train station if you don't have luggage. Right next door is the museum with Leonardo Da Vinci's "Lady with the Weasel". Very charming, and I have stayed there twice and will stay there again.

This hotel is in a perfect location, just inside the city walls at the Florianska gate and therefore easy to walk anywhere in the old town. The hotel has been beautifully modernised and our room was big and light and airy. The staff speaks english and seems efficient. No shower curtain at the bath means it is impossible to shower without soaking the floor (which has a drain in it, so it must be OK to do that except there isn't anywhere to put your clothes...) and the room was rather noisy from the street, with no double glazing and echoes bouncing off the town wall (particularly hoof beats from the carriage horses and drunken shouts of weekend revellers). Breakfast was adequate, and the hotel was spotlessly clean throughout. I have no experience of any other Cracovian hotel but this one seems well run, inexpensive, and nicely located and I would have no hesitation in recommending it for a weekend base in Krakow.
reviews.title: Clean and airy

reviews.text: My 4th visit to Krakow and first visit to this hotel. I like to try different ones everytime I come because there are so many to choose from.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel but!!!!
nice hotel...noisy at night
reviews.text: The hotel inside is super and spotless and staff are friendly. We had a triple room which was very large but unfortunately the windows overlooked Ul.Florianska and the McDonalds. Noise , noise and more noise.
Breakfast was OK but I have had a lot better on my previous trips at other cheaper priced hotels.
reviews.title: Good Hotel, Great Location

reviews.text: I dont want to do the hotel an injustice because its very very nice but...No..I would not stop there again. Shame but that the honest truth!
reviews.title: Great locale but...
Nice hotel, shame about the noise!!!
reviews.text: I stayed at the Hotel Polski Bialym Orlem for 3 nights. The hotel is very clean...and has a nice breakfast area. However our room was on a very busy street...across from a McDonalds that was open until 3am. All 3 nights we were awakened with loud singing and yelling..long after the retaurant closed. I would recommend a room away from the street.The location is very good otherwise.....and the staff very accomodating.

Hotel Polski is located just inside the wall of the old city, and only a short walk from the main railway station & the old city main square. Single room was moderate in size, but with very good facilities and an excellent bathroom. Buffet breakfast was quite good.
reviews.title: Great Location inside city wall

reviews.text: My husband, I and my mother in law had the most wonderful time here from 14th to 18th December 2006. The staff could not have been friendlier and provided us with maps and gave advice on anything we asked, such as markets and trips to the Royal Castle and salt mines. The room was simple but adequate and even the single room was fine, which is usually the weak point when we travel together. The breakfasts were yummy and if you wanted a cooked breakfast, you only had to ask and one was provided without charge or any fuss. Needless to say with all the brilliant food we experienced during our stay, we didn't need a large breakfast after the first day! We had a great time at the Christmas market and thoroughly recommend Poland and especially Krakow for at least a long weekend as there is so much to see. It really is the most beautiful city and the people generally are very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Fantastic value and home from home!

reviews.text: Nine of us recently had a long weekend in Kracow primarily for Christmas shopping. We stayed at the Polski Hotel for it's location. It is just inside the city walls and a five minute walk down a buzzing street to the Old Town square.
reviews.title: Warm and Cosy in December

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were spacious with good bathrooms and nicely decorated. Ours was a corner room so had an especially large entrance hallway. There was a cosy bar which is important if your'e in a group as a meeting place. The breakfast was interesting. As well as hot Frankfurtersand scrambled eggs there was the usual array of cheeses and pates with bread rolls and pastries. There was fruit and yoghurt and some rather strange looking salads - but when in Rome!. Overall I was impressed with the hotel which was very reasonably priced.
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back

reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from our first visit to Krakow and the Polski Hotel. We really enjoyed the hotel, fabulous location, very clean, pleasant room, minibar, enormous bathroom and the hotel staff were all extremly helpful and pleasant. Because of other comments here we were worried about the noise and got a back room with minus view . Also the room was a bit small but knowing all this I will return to this hotel when we return to Krakow.
reviews.title: Definately going back!!!!!

description: Hotel Polski "Pod Białym Orłem" is a mid-size, private hotel and is in the heart of old Krakow. It is located at the corner of Florianska and PijarskaStreets, in front of the mediaeval defence walls, on which Cracow's painters present their paintings. Our next-door neighbour is the Czartoryski Museum,which houses Leonardo's famous Lady with an ermine.The hotel is one of the oldest in Krakow. For almost 200 years it has been offering accommodation for visitors.Charming, old interiors offer our guests modern amenities, It's only a stone's throw from anywhere here!
